author: Freya Jones
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer welcomed a three-year program by Amazon.com Inc. to invest £40 billion ($54 billion) in the British economy over the next three years, including opening four new warehouses.
title: UK Welcomes £40 Billion Amazon Investment Plan in Warehouses

author: Leen Al-Rashdan
description: Several Persian Gulf states, including Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, have reopened their airspace and resumed operations at some of the world’s busiest airports after halting flights as Iran launched air strikes at a US base in Qatar.
title: Gulf States Reopen Airspace and Resume Flight Operations

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will vow to spend 5% of British economic output on security by 2035, embracing an ambitious NATO target sought by President Donald Trump without providing a path on how to get there.
title: UK Vows to Spend 5% of GDP on Security by 2035 to Hit NATO Goal

author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided US Supreme Court lifted a judge’s order that required President Donald Trump’s administration to give people 10 days notice and a chance to object before they are deported to a so-called third country.
title: Supreme Court Blocks Deportation-Notice Rule in Trump Win

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Gauging the Fallout From the US Strikes on Iran

author: Peter Martin, Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Iran’s missile attack on a US air base in Qatar was telegraphed well in advance, suggesting Tehran intended a symbolic show of force while offering a way to de-escalate after US airstrikes over the weekend.
title: Iran Missile Strike on Qatar Base Fits De-Escalation Playbook

author: Greg Ryan
description: A group of Harvard University alumni urged the school not to cave to the Trump administration’s demands as it restarts talks with the White House.
title: Harvard Alumni Group Calls on School to Resist Amid Trump Feud

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuador’s government offered a $1 million reward on Monday for information leading to the recapture of suspected drug lord Rolando Federico Gomez after he escaped from a Guayaquil penitentiary disguised in a military uniform to pass checkpoints unhindered.
title: Noboa Grapples With Another High-Profile Prison Break in Ecuador

author: Gabrielle Coppola
description: Ford Motor Co. intensified its campaign to preserve clean energy manufacturing subsidies Monday, warning jobs at its electric-vehicle battery plant in southwestern Michigan could be at risk if Republicans in Congress pare back tax credits in President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar economic package.
title: Ford Escalates Battery Job Warnings as Congress Mulls EV Cuts

author: Thomas Seal
description: The European Union and Canada have signed a security partnership that moves them closer to cooperation on military purchases, as Prime Minister Mark Carney aims to reduce his country’s dependence on the US for defense.
title: EU and Canada Sign Security Pact as Carney Pivots From US

author: Kurt Wagner
description: Meta’s WhatsApp messaging platform has been added to a list of apps banned from government-issued devices for congressional staffers in the US House of Representatives, a move driven by concerns about the app’s data security.
title: US House Bans WhatsApp From Staffers’ Government-Issued Devices

author: Samy Adghirni, Ott Ummelas
description: France and Norway together questioned the legality of military strikes on Iran by Israel and the US, breaking with allies who have endorsed the attacks.
title: France, Norway Say US, Israel Military Strikes on Iran Lack Legal Basis

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Leaders from Poland and the three Baltic nations have called on the European Union to step up financial support for plans to reinforce their borders, the first line of defense on the bloc’s eastern flank.
title: Poland, Baltic States Seek EU Help to Reinforce Eastern Borders

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Portugal’s government approved several measures to tighten immigration rules, including extending the period required for a foreigner to obtain citizenship to as many as 10 years from five.
title: Portugal Increases Time Required to Get Citizenship to 10 Years

description: Al Udeid Air Base outside Doha, Qatar, on June 18. Photographer: Planet Labs PBC/AP Photo
title: Iran Launches Missiles Toward US Air Base in Qatar

author: Jef Feeley
description: Omnicom Group Inc., the third-largest US advertising agency, agreed to stop withholding online ads for political reasons to clear the way for federal antitrust regulators to approve the company’s $13.5 billion buyout of rival Interpublic Group.
title: FTC Clears Omnicom Deal After Barring Advertising Boycotts Over Politics

author: Fiona MacDonald
description: Iran fired missiles at a US air base in Qatar after promising it would respond “proportionately and decisively” to President Donald Trump’s weekend airstrikes on three of its nuclear facilities.
title: Iran Launches Missiles at US Bases in Retaliatory Strike

author: Aashna Shah
description: US states are sounding the alarm over the billions in revenue they stand to lose under the Trump administration’s broadscale government cuts and the impact of his trade policies.
title: US State Budget Wounds Intensify From Trump, DOGE Policy Shifts

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Dasha Afanasieva
description: US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and Russia’s continued war in Ukraine should act as a wake-up call for NATO to boost defense spending, the Dutch defense minister said.
title: Dutch Minister Calls Iran Crisis a Wake-Up Call on NATO Spending

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: By refusing to agree spending increases to appease US President Donald Trump, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez threatens to derail a NATO summit that Secretary General Mark Rutte needs to run smoothly for the sake of the military alliance’s future survival.
title: Spain and Rutte Locked in Defense Showdown on Eve of NATO Summit

author: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: A Ukrainian deputy prime minister said he’s cooperating with authorities after the nation’s anti-graft watchdogs announced that a senior official is a suspect in a corruption investigation.
title: Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ensnared in Corruption Probe

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Pictures show the destruction at the Isfahan facility doesn’t include the buildings likely housing three research reactors.
title: Satellite Images Suggest US Avoided Iran’s Nuclear Reactors

author: Paul Wallace, Fiona MacDonald
description: The US and UK governments told citizens based in Qatar to lie low after Iran vowed to retaliate against an American attack on its nuclear facilities.
title: US, UK Urge Citizens in Qatar to Shelter as Iran Weighs Response

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Iran will respond to the US’s attacks on the Islamic Republic’s nuclear facilities “proportionately and decisively,” Abdolrahim Mousavi, chief of staff of Iran’s armed forces, said in a video posted on social media by Iran’s state broadcaster.
title: Iran’s Military Plans ‘Proportionate’ Response to US Strikes

author: Paul Burkhardt
description: Symbion Power unit Hydro-Link will sign a pact with Angola’s government on Tuesday to build a $1.5 billion private transmission line that will connect hydropower sites with mines producing critical minerals in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo.
title: Angola, US Firm to Sign Pact to Build $1.5 Billion Power Line

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Jordan Fabian
description: President Donald Trump demanded that energy producers keep down oil prices following US military strikes on Iran, which drove prices higher amid fears the attack could provoke a wider conflict in the Middle East.
title: Trump Warns Against Rising Oil Prices Following Iran Attack

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott vetoed a bill that would have banned recreational THC products made from hemp, leaving open a loophole that has allowed shops to sell edibles, joints and drinks that create a high similar to marijuana.
title: Texas Governor Vetoes Hemp Bill That Aimed to Crack Down on THC

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany is planning to lift core defense spending to 3.5% of gross domestic product over the next five years as part of a massive increase in government investment in the military.
title: Germany to Increase Core Defense Spending to 3.5% of GDP by 2029

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Ireland’s Finance Minister ruled out scrapping a bonus tax imposed on the domestic Irish banks.
title: Donohoe Says He Plans to Keep Irish Bank Bonus Cap in Place

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Tensions in the Middle East are adding risk in the energy and trade sectors, according to the Eurogroup President.
title: Ireland’s Donohoe Sees Energy, Trade Risk From Mideast Tensions

author: Olivia Fletcher, Stephen Carroll
description: Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said US pharmaceutical tariffs would cost the economy thousands of jobs and that his focus is on maintaining competitiveness to protect the country’s long-term success
title: Ireland Sees Thousands of Jobs at Risk From US Pharma Tariffs

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: Support for South Africa’s biggest political party rebounded after it was forced to scrap plans to raise value-added tax and now stands at 40%, the same as it garnered in last year’s elections, while the nation’s coalition government enjoys widespread popularity, an opinion poll found.
title: South Africa’s Biggest Political Party Regains Ground, Poll finds

author: Patrick Howell O'Neill
description: US officials are warning businesses to brace for potential Iranian cyberattacks following American airstrikes on the country’s nuclear sites, an event that experts say could draw a relatively small response from hackers.
title: US Braces for ‘Low-Level’ Cyberattacks by Iran After Airstrikes

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Israel’s warplanes kept up attacks on Iranian missile systems, airfields and the Fordow nuclear site following US strikes at the weekend, as debate raged in the country over how long the campaign should continue.
title: Debate Rages Within Israel on When to Stop Strikes Against Iran

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand announced a raft of security and trade measures to cripple transnational crime syndicates in Cambodia, as Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra seeks an upper hand in a simmering border dispute with its neighbor.
title: Thailand Targets Cambodian Scam Centers as Border Dispute Rages

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte has asked the Senate to dismiss the impeachment case against her as it violated the one-year ban set under the constitution.
title: Philippines VP Sara Duterte Asks Senate to Dismiss Impeachment Case

author: Henry Meyer
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin denounced “absolutely unprovoked aggression” against Iran, as he met a top official from Tehran the day after the US strike on Iranian nuclear facilities.
title: Putin Slams ‘Unprovoked’ Attack on Iran as He Meets Tehran Envoy

author: Josh Xiao
description: China moved to tighten controls over two chemicals that can be used to make fentanyl, in an apparent olive branch to the US that may help maintain their fragile trade truce.
title: China Tightens Fentanyl Controls in Goodwill Gesture to Trump

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran said US strikes on its nuclear sites over the weekend have delivered an “irreparable blow” to the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty, rendering it ineffective.
title: Iran Says Nuclear Arms-Control Treaty Irreparably Damaged by US

author: Tom Orlik
description: Treasury buyers will be the ultimate arbiters on whether MAGA math adds up.
title: What Mike Tyson and the Bond Market Can Teach Trump on Debt

author: Nacha Cattan, Arvelisse Bonilla Ramos
description: The outcome of the race could help define the path forward for the Democratic Party.
title: NYC to Vote During Heatwave as Cost, Crime Dominate Mayoral Race

author: Fabiola Zerpa, Joe Lovinger
description: Christi Fraga, the mayor of Doral, Florida, is being bombarded with questions about US immigration rules she doesn’t know how to answer.
title: Home to Trump Golf Resort Faces Growing Fear Amid Deportation Policy Changes

author: Anthony Halpin
description: With Trump’s attention elsewhere, Russia’s leader may get an increasingly free hand to pursue his war aims.
title: Putin May Gain From Trump’s Focus on Iran

author: Kati Pohjanpalo
description: NATO is in turmoil just as the military alliance confronts the deadliest conflict on its doorstep since World War II.
title: How Trump’s Spurning of European Allies Is Transforming NATO

author: Erik Wasson
description: President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending agenda is nearing a climatic vote in the Senate this week in the wake of air strikes on Iran, which risk embroiling the US in a prolonged Middle East conflict.
title: Senate Readies Tax Bill for Vote With Holdouts Threatening Delay

author: Arsalan Shahla, Eltaf Najafizada
description: Iran vowed retaliation and kept up attacks on Israel following the US strikes on its nuclear facilities over the weekend, fueling fears of a wider war in the Middle East and rattling global markets.
title: Iran’s Promise of Payback Keeps World Powers, Markets on Edge

author: Ram Anand
description: Support for Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim rose as he crossed the midpoint of his five-year term amid political stability.
title: Malaysian PM Anwar’s Popularity Rises on Stability and Growth

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s mainstream parties signed an agreement to form a new government after months of political turmoil, with a key goal to tackle the European Union’s biggest budget deficit.
title: Romanian Pro-EU Parties Sign Coalition Deal to Tackle Budget Gap

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party suffered its worst-ever result in a Tokyo metropolitan election, losing its spot as the biggest political force on the assembly less than a month before voters deliver a verdict on Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s premiership in a national vote.
title: Japan’s LDP Suffers Bruising Loss in Tokyo Before National Vote

author: Kamran Haider, Jon Herskovitz
description: Pakistan condemned the US’s bombing of nuclear sites in Iran while at the same time taking steps to build stronger ties with President Donald Trump, suggesting limits to how far Islamabad will go in supporting Tehran in the crisis.
title: Pakistan Condemns US Strikes in Iran While Embracing Trump

author: Thomas Seal
description: The European Union and Canada are expected to sign a security and defense partnership on Monday at a summit that will kick off a range of discussions about how they can work closer together.
title: EU and Canada Prepare to Sign Security Pact Ahead of NATO Summit

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Olesia Safronova
description: Russia unleashed another massive missile and drone strike on Kyiv that killed at least five people as Moscow steps up aerial attacks on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine’s capital.
title: Russia Hits Kyiv’s Civilian Infrastructure Killing At Least Five

author: Alastair Gale, Sarah Hilton
description: Japan denied a report that the US directly asked Tokyo to raise its defense spending to 3.5% of annual gross domestic product, with its top government spokesman saying that the amount of spending was less important than how Japan raises its military capabilities.
title: Japan Says No US Demand for Defense Spending Worth 3.5% of GDP

author: Adrian Wooldridge
description: The city’s mayor, Sadiq Khan, needs to take growing disorder on the streets more seriously.
title: What Turning a Blind Eye to Deviant Behavior Is Doing to London

author: Matthew Brooker
description: How a high-speed rail project became a fiscal monster.
title: Britain's HS2 Is Frankenstein's Railway

author: John Cheng
description: UBS Group AG strategists downgraded Thai stocks to neutral from overweight, citing recent political uncertainty which could impact policy direction and investor sentiment.
title: UBS Downgrades Thai Stocks to Neutral as Political Woes Weigh

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte slammed President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. for leaning towards the US, while signaling openness to friendlier ties with China.
title: Philippine VP Duterte Criticizes Marcos for Leaning Towards US

author: Shery Ahn, Yuko Takeo
description: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva warned that the US strikes on Iran could potentially have broader impacts beyond energy channels, as global uncertainty escalates.
title: IMF’s Georgieva Warns of Broader Risks From US Strikes on Iran

author: Golnar Motevalli, Peter Martin
description: When the dust settled on Iran’s nuclear sites on Sunday after a US bombing raid that President Donald Trump said had “totally obliterated” its atomic program, one thing was still missing: its highly enriched uranium, which international authorities haven't seen for more than a week.
title: A Weakened Iran Can Still Inflict Pain on the US — and the World

author: Sarah Holder, David Fox
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: what’s next for the Israel-Iran war after 14 US “bunker busters.”
title: US Strikes Iran in Operation Midnight Hammer

author: Bill Faries
description: The US State Department issued a “Worldwide Caution” alert for American citizens, flagging the potential of travel disruptions and demonstrations following the US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.
title: US Issues ‘Worldwide Caution’ for Americans After Attack on Iran
